general_advisory: Complete transplanting of rice by first fortnight of August. Regular monitoring of the crop for incidence of pest and diseases should be done and appropriate plant protection measure should be taken. Make arrangements for draining out excess water from the field of Pulses, Maize, Groundnut and vegetables. Farmers are advised to make bund for conserving rainwater in the field.

advisory: Active Tillering stage Pest Management: If leaf blast is observed in rice field, spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG (Nativo) @ 80 g/acre or Isoprothiolane 40 EC (Sultan/Fujita/Fujione) @ 300 ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water. Repeat the spray at 7-10 days interval.

There is a chance of infestation of sheath rot and sheath blight in paddy. To manage this disease spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25 % WG (Nativo) @ 80 gram/acre or Propiconazole 25% EC (Tilt/Zerox/Dhan/Bumper) @ 200ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water.
If BLB is observed, spray Copper oxychloride 50% WP @ 600g/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water.

Vegetative Hoeing, weeding followed by earthing up should be completed by the end of this week. Monitor your field regularly for signs of pest infestation. To prevent sucking pests like aphids and thrips, neem-based pesticide (1500 ppm) may be sprayed @ 3ml/ lit of water.
Vegetative Hoeing should be done at 20-25 DAS in groundnut crop. To manage Tikka disease, spray Chlorothalonil 75% WP @ 400g/acre or Mancozeb 75% WP @ 600 g/acre or Hexaconazole 5% E.C @ 300ml/acre.
Vegetative Keep the field clean. Monitor the crops for any disease and pests. To control Chilli thrips, spray Malathion or Imidacloprid 17.8 SL @ 2 ml/lt.
Leaf blight in Chilli can be controlled by spraying carbendazim or Mancozeb fungicides @ 2-3 g/lt.

Flowering and Fruiting To manage Fruit fly in cucurbits, prepare a poison bait by mixing 200-gram Jaggery, 4 ripen banana, and 2ml Imidacloprid in 4-litre of water. Keep this mixture in Plastic cups or clay pots @ 8-nos/acre. The fruit flies will be attracted to this and eventually get killed by falling into the poison baits. In extreme case, for chemical control spray Spinosad @ 2.5ml/10 lit.

Planting August and September is the optimum time for Tomato planting. Grow Tomato varieties like Utkal Kumari (BT-10), Utkal Deepti (BT-2), Utkal Raja, Utkal Pragyan, and Swarna Sampad. For one-acre planting 150 to 200 grams of seeds are required.

African marigold can be grown from the month of August till January. Suitable varieties are Giant ball, African yellow, Early yellow, Early orange, Giant ball African orange, Crown of gold, etc. Before planting apply 20 tons of FYM, 40 kg Nitrogen, 80 kg phosphorus, and 80 kg Potash. 25 to 30 days old seedlings should be planted on the main field.
